relation: Great for these types of students
Nothing if you attend the Saginaw campus.
Stay on top of your financial aid. Don't lend more than you need. Attend classes and turn in all assignments.

Davenport is to expensive for a degree that will most likely not hold any weight if you leave the state of Michigan. The staff was great. The class size allowed an intimate environment with your peers and teacher.
pageTitle: Davenport University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {223897=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 61522=I would rate Davenport University with high ratings as they have really proved to me that their instructors/facilitators are there to help each student achieve their goals. The courses are easy to understand and each student has the option to take 7-10-15 week courses and are able to complete there degree. If it was not for the advisers, financial aid and instructors then I would not be close to graduation., 202034=I loved Davenport because it allowed me to return to school full-time as a wife, mother and full-time working adult. I received my Associate and Bachelors from there starting classes in the Fall of 2010 and ending in August of 2013. It was a great experience and I found an interesting new field in Health Information Management. The instructors were helpful and for both degrees I completed my courses primarily online with the exception of 2 on campus courses. I graduated with honors and feel so proud ad thankful for my experience there!, 125342=Be prepared to put in many study hours to do well. The 7 week accelerated courses are a great way to complete the program much faster. Apply for the in-house scholarship for $1500 per semester.}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Am learning a lot It's a good school I recieved more help with funding my education from Davenport than I did from WCCCD Login to rate or flag the reviews Max from Middleville, MI 10/16/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 2 out of 2 people found this review useful. 3 of 63 Categories Comments Great for these types of students anyone going in to the Business, technology or nursing this is the school for you. If you are interested in Biometric security, we are 1 of only very few universities in the nation that offer it. Tips for prospective students Apply early. Keep your GPA up. and ask lots of questions, the staff is always willing to answer any you may have. Bang for the buck Davenport is a career focused college. You start working on classes related to your career right away.
